description: ERECTION OF A GROUND FLOOR REAR AND SIDE EXTENSION, AND REAR FIRST FLOOR EXTENSION.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - Commencement of development (Full Permission) - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: 

33DR 01F
33DR 02F
33DR 04F
33DR 05F
33DR 06F
33DR 07F
33DR 08F
33DR 09F
Block Plan

Condition : 3 - Materials as Specified - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form and approved plans unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - Obscured Glazing - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied, the first floor bathroom windows on the eastern side elevation shall be glazed with obscured glass and be maintained as such thereafter.

Condition : 5 - No Use of Flat Roof  - Access to the flat roof of the development hereby permitted shall be for maintenance or emergency purposes only, and the flat roof shall not be used as a roof garden, terrace, patio or similar amenity area.

Condition : 6 - INFORMATIVE (Party Wall Act) - The applicant is advised to check the requirements of the Party Wall Act 1996 relating to work on an existing wall shared with another property, building on the boundary with a neighbouring property, or excavating near a neighbouring building. Further information is available at the following link: 
https://www.gov.uk/party-walls-building-works

Condition : 7 - INFORMATIVE
Note to Applicant -Approved Schemes
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework, London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to the delivery of sustainable development, by:
1. Providing a formal pre-application advice service, details to be found on Planning pre-application advice service on LBM's website
2. Providing written policies and guidance, which is available to view on LBM's website.
3. Where appropriate, negotiating amendments to secure a positive decision.
4. Determining applications in a timely manner including providing a fast track service, details to be found on Get a quicker planning decision on LBM's website.

In this instance:

i) The application was acceptable as submitted, and approved without delay.
